articleData.blog_content:
You know that feeling to do something different when you enter college? That urge to make a name somewhere in this competitive world, made me join this organization named, Desire Foundation.

Little did I know, that in search of personality development, I would end up becoming a better human being, who now looks at life more than a blessing.

I'm honored to share these experiences with these bunch of people who are willing to put in every effort to change lives and make this world a better place to live in.

My journey from giving an interview to taking one, from just attending a meeting to organizing one, from a follower to a leader, has been incredibly amazing. And I owe it all to this set of exceptional mentors and seniors who have always been there for every inch of assistance and literally taught me the difference between ˜a leader' and ˜a boss'.

Desire has not only given me these experiences but also a sense of motive in life, in a very unusual way.

The impact of our work might be very trivial compared to the countless issues faced by our society, but we know that big changes come with small steps. And I wish to be a part of this journey through all these miles.
